class.name: Viewport
class.brief_description: Creates a sub-view into the screen.
class.description: A Viewport creates a different view into the screen, or a sub-view inside another viewport. Children 2D Nodes will display on it, and children Camera 3D nodes will render on it too. Optionally, a viewport can have its own 2D or 3D world, so they don't share what they draw with other viewports. If a viewport is a child of a [ViewportContainer], it will automatically take up its size, otherwise it must be set manually. Viewports can also choose to be audio listeners, so they generate positional audio depending on a 2D or 3D camera child of it. Also, viewports can be assigned to different screens in case the devices have multiple screens. Finally, viewports can also behave as render targets, in which case they will not be visible unless the associated texture is used to draw.

method.name: find_world
method.description: Returns the 3D world of the viewport, or if none the world of the parent viewport.

method.name: find_world_2d
method.description: Returns the 2D world of the viewport.

method.name: get_final_transform
method.description: Returns the total transform of the viewport.

method.name: get_modal_stack_top
method.description: Returns the topmost modal in the stack.

method.name: get_mouse_position
method.description: Returns the mouse position relative to the viewport.

method.name: get_render_info
method.description: Returns information about the viewport from the rendering pipeline.

method.name: get_size_override
method.description: Returns the size override set with [method set_size_override].

method.name: get_viewport_rid
method.description: Returns the viewport's RID from the [VisualServer].

method.name: get_visible_rect
method.description: Returns the visible rectangle in global screen coordinates.

method.name: gui_get_drag_data
method.description: Returns the drag data from the GUI, that was previously returned by [method Control.get_drag_data].

method.name: gui_has_modal_stack
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if there are visible modals on-screen.

method.name: is_size_override_enabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the size override is enabled. See [method set_size_override].

method.name: is_size_override_stretch_enabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the size stretch override is enabled. See [method set_size_override_stretch].

method.name: set_size_override
method.description: Sets the size override of the viewport. If the [code]enable[/code] parameter is [code]true[/code] the override is used, otherwise it uses the default size. If the size parameter is [code](-1, -1)[/code], it won't update the size.

method.name: set_size_override_stretch
method.description: If [code]true[/code] the size override affects stretch as well.

method.name: update_worlds
method.description: Forces update of the 2D and 3D worlds.

method.name: warp_mouse
method.description: Warps the mouse to a position relative to the viewport.

If [code]true[/code] the viewport rendering will receive benefits from High Dynamic Range algorithm. Default value: [code]true[/code].

If [code]true[/code] the result after 3D rendering will not have a linear to sRGB color conversion applied. This is important when the viewport is used as a render target where the result is used as a texture on a 3D object rendered in another viewport. It is also important if the viewport is used to create data that is not color based (noise, heightmaps, pickmaps, etc.). Do not enable this when the viewport is used as a texture on a 2D object or if the viewport is your final output.

signal.name: size_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the size of the viewport is changed, whether by [method set_size_override], resize of window, or some other means.
